[?25l[H[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m zypper docker help list-patches opensuse:13.2                                                                [2;1HNAME:[K
   list-patches - List all the available patches[K
[K
USAGE:[K
   command list-patches [command options] [arguments...][K
[K
OPTIONS:[K
   --bugzilla           List available needed patches for all Bugzilla issues, or issues whose number matches the given string (--bugzilla=#).[K
   --cve                List available needed patches for all CVE issues, or issues whose number matches the given string (--cve=#).[K
   --date               List patches issued up to, but not including, the specified date (YYYY-MM-DD).[K
   --issues             Look for issues whose number, summary, or description matches the specified string (--issue=string).[K
   -g, --category       List only patches with this category.[K
   [K
[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m zypper docker list-patches --cveopensuse:13.2                                                                [18;42H[?12l[?25h

   -g, --category       List only patches with this category.[K
   [K

[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m [K[20;1H[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m # this spawns a container based on the image we specified[K
[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m # and then runs the zypper ref and zypper list-patches command[K

[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m # for example I can see all the CVE associated with a docker image[K

[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m [K[20;1H[31m[1mdemo:~ #(B[m # this spawns a container based on the image we specified[K

[1;36r[H[2B   list-patches - List all the available patches[1;37r[H[3;49H
[1;36r[H[9;25HList available needed patches for all Bugzilla issues, or issues whose number matches the given string (--bugzilla=#).[1;37r[H[10;25H
